column4: anybody got any kind of wireless usb adapters working with 10.10?
Ok, any sugestion for wireless adapters? have tried two of them with ndiswrapper - no luck
have you seen the list of supported wifi devices?
do the math - if it works for an older release, it'll work for a newer release
which netgear?
it's possible you're pulling my chain.
the lsusb command doesn't show it?
well, get the card again and try again
great, what's the usb id?
returned it to where?
so you don't have ANY wireless cards with you right now?
I'm sorry you felt you had to jump to that incorrect conclusion
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HardwareSupportComponentsWirelessNetworkCardsNetgear#USB  if it's in that list and says it's supported, then it will work

if it doesn't work out-of-the-box then it's because 10.10 changed something, then getting someone in here along with the forums to help you would be the correct route to go, not to mention less costly
checking it out...
please read this again, at the VERY BOTTOM of the page: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HardwareSupportComponentsWirelessNetworkCardsNetgear#USB
doesn't matter much, did you happen to ever try wicd?
sometimes the vendor has a linux driver
not with netgear/cisco
it's just not always obvious
d-link is bottom of the barrel
